headline: Security Best Practices You Should Know

digest_items.title: Verify mobile app security
digest_items.why: Mobile apps often have unique vulnerabilities like insecure storage
digest_items.fix: Use OWASP Mobile Security Testing Guide for comprehensive testing

digest_items.title: Implement security monitoring
digest_items.why: Real-time monitoring detects attacks and anomalies early
digest_items.fix: Use SIEM tools and set up alerts for suspicious activities

digest_items.title: Enable MFA for all admin accounts
digest_items.why: Multi-factor authentication prevents account takeover even if passwords are stolen
digest_items.fix: Use authenticator apps (Google Authenticator, Authy) or hardware keys (YubiKey)

digest_items.title: Implement data classification
digest_items.why: Classification ensures appropriate security controls for sensitive data
digest_items.fix: Label data as public, internal, confidential, or restricted

digest_items.title: Enable audit logging
digest_items.why: Audit logs are essential for incident response and compliance
digest_items.fix: Log authentication events, data access, and configuration changes

digest_items.title: Review third-party vendor access
digest_items.why: Excessive vendor permissions increase attack surface and compliance risk
digest_items.fix: Audit vendor access quarterly and apply principle of least privilege

digest_items.title: Implement security awareness training
digest_items.why: Human error is the leading cause of security incidents
digest_items.fix: Conduct quarterly phishing simulations and security training

digest_items.title: Use security headers scanner
digest_items.why: Missing security headers leave applications vulnerable to common attacks
digest_items.fix: Use securityheaders.com to scan and implement recommended headers
